qas.question: Einstein and what other two individuals revisited the black-body problem in 1905?
Who came up with the term, "ultraviolet catastrophe"?
When did Paul Ehrenfest come up with the name "ultraviolet catastrophe"?
When was the first Solvay Conference held?
Who received the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1918?
What did Rayleigh & Jeans and Einstein prove independently in 1905?

answers.text: classical electromagnetism could never account for the observed spectrum

qas.question: What name did Paul Ehrenfest give to the proofs from Einstein and Rayleigh & Jeans?
When was the first Solvay Conference held?
What was the topic of the first Solvay Conference?
In what year did Planck receive the Nobel Prize in Physics for his discovery of energy quanta?
What other two individuals aside from Einstein revisited the black-body problem in 1945?
Who never used the term, "ultraviolet catastrophe"?
When was the last Solvay Conference held?
Who refused the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1918?
Who received the Nobel Prize in Physics based on the destruction of energy quanta?

context: The black-body problem was revisited in 1905, when <a0_0><b10_0>Rayleigh and Jeans<b10_0/><a0_0/> (on the one hand) and Einstein (on the other hand) independently proved that <a5_0>classical electromagnetism could never account for the observed spectrum<a5_0/>. These proofs are commonly known as <a6_0>the "ultraviolet catastrophe"<a6_0/>, a name coined by <a1_0><b11_0>Paul Ehrenfest<b11_0/><a1_0/> in <a2_0>1911<a2_0/>. They contributed greatly (along with Einstein's work on the photoelectric effect) to convincing physicists that Planck's postulate of quantized energy levels was more than a mere mathematical formalism. The very first Solvay Conference in <a3_0><a7_0><b12_0>1911<b12_0/><a7_0/><a3_0/> was devoted to <a8_0>"the theory of radiation and quanta"<a8_0/>. <a4_0><b13_0><b14_0>Max Planck<b14_0/><b13_0/><a4_0/> received the <a9_0>1918<a9_0/> Nobel Prize in Physics "in recognition of the services he rendered to the advancement of Physics by his discovery of energy quanta".
